intro: Thottea duchartrei, commonly known as the Blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers with white markings. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, lance-shaped leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Thottea duchartrei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
